Docs.summary: This is a primary interface in a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object. Use this primary interface only when the method you want to use shares the same name as an event of the COM object; in this case, cast to this interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event. Otherwise, use the .NET interface that is derived from the COM coclass to access methods, properties, and events of the COM object. For information about the COM object, see .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Actions As Actions

Docs.summary: Returns an collection that represents all the available actions for the item. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddBusinessCard([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook.ContactItem contact) runtime managed

Docs.param: The contact item from which to obtain the business card information.
Docs.summary: Appends contact information based on the Electronic Business Card (EBC) associated with the specified object to the object.

remarks.para: This method adds contact information, generated from the information stored in the ContactItem object, to the existing MailItem object. The information included depends on the value of the property for the MailItem object:

item.description: A vCard (.vcf) file is created and added to the Attachments collection of the MailItem object.
A vCard (.vcf) file is created and added to the Attachments collection of the MailItem object.
An image of the business card is generated and included in the Body property of the MailItem object, and a vCard (.vcf) file is created and added to the Attachments collection of the MailItem object.

remarks.para: Note: The attached vCard file contains only the contact information included in the Electronic Business Card associated with the ContactItem object. Any contact information not displayed in the Electronic Business Card is excluded from the vCard file.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AlternateRecipientAllowed { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean (bool in C#) that is True if the mail message can be forwarded. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the parent Outlook application for the object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Attachments As Attachments

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents all the attachments for the specified item. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AutoForwarded { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: A Boolean (bool in C#) value that returns True if the item was automatically forwarded. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AutoResolvedWinner As Boolean
public: property bool AutoResolvedWinner { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean (bool in C#) that determines if the item is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution. Read-only.

remarks.para: A value of False does not necessarily indicate that the item is a loser of an automatic conflict resolution. The item could be in conflict with another item.

If an item has of its property greater than zero and if its AutoResolvedWinner property is True, it is a winner of an automatic conflict resolution. On the other hand, if the item is in conflict and has its AutoResolvedWinner property as False, it is a loser in an automatic conflict resolution.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ BCC { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) representing the display list of blind carbon copy (BCC) names for a . Read/write.

remarks.para: This property contains the display names only. The collection should be used to modify the BCC recipients.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ BillingInformation { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) representing the billing information associated with the Outlook item. Read/write.

remarks.para: This is a free-form text field.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Body { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) representing the clear-text body of the Outlook item. Read/write.

remarks.para: The property allows you to programmatically change the editor that is used for the body of an item.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlBodyFormat BodyFormat { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlBodyFormat get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlBodyFormat value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an constant indicating the format of the body text. Read/write.

remarks.para: The body text format determines the standard used to display the text of the message. Microsoft Outlook provides three body text format options: Plain Text, Rich Text (RTF), and HTML.
All text formatting will be lost when the BodyFormat property is switched from RTF to HTML and vice-versa.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Categories { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) representing the categories assigned to the Outlook item. Read/write.

remarks.para: Categories is a delimited string of category names that have been assigned to an Outlook item. This property uses the character specified in the value name, sList, under HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\International in the Windows registry, as the delimiter for multiple category values. To convert the string of category names to an array of category names, use the Microsoft Visual Basic function Split.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ CC { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) representing the display list of carbon copy (CC) names for a . Read/write.

remarks.para: This property contains the display names only. The collection should be used to modify the CC recipients.

public: property System::String ^ ConversationID { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) that uniquely identifies a object that the object belongs to. Read-only.

remarks.para: This property associates items with a conversation. These items and the conversation all have the same value in their ConversationID property.
This property corresponds with the MAPI property PidTagConversationId.

If the MailItem object is created in a version of Microsoft Outlook earlier than Microsoft Outlook 2010, or if Outlook is running in online mode against a version of Microsoft Exchange Server earlier than Microsoft Exchange Server 2010, this property returns the same value as the property.

public: property DateTime CreationTime { DateTime get(); };

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime DeferredDeliveryTime { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime indicating the date and time the mail message is to be delivered. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagDeferredDeliveryTime.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Delete() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes the item from the folder that contains the item.

remarks.para: The Delete method deletes a single item in a collection. To delete all items in the collection of a folder, you must delete each item starting with the last item in the folder. For example, in the items collection of a folder, AllItems, if there are n number of items in the folder, start deleting the item at AllItems.Item(n), decrementing the index each time until you delete AllItems.Item(1).
The Delete method moves the item from the containing folder to the Deleted Items folder. If the containing folder is the Deleted Items folder, the Delete method removes the item permanently.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DeleteAfterSubmit { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that is True if a copy of the mail message is not saved upon being sent, and False if a copy is saved. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Display([in]object Modal) runtime managed
Public Sub Display (Optional Modal As Object)

Docs.param: True to make the window modal. The default value is False.
Docs.summary: Displays a new object for the item.

remarks.para: The Display method is supported for explorer and inspector windows for the sake of backward compatibility. To activate an explorer or inspector window, use the method.

If you attempt to open an "unsafe" file system object (or "freedoc" file) by using the Microsoft Outlook object model, you receive the E_FAIL return code in the C or C++ programming languages. In Outlook 2000 and earlier, you could open an "unsafe" file system object by using the Display method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DownloadState As OlDownloadState

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool EnableSharedAttachments { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: This object, member, or enumeration is deprecated and is not intended to be used in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property EntryID As String
public: property System::String ^ EntryID { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) representing the unique Entry ID of the object. Read-only.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagEntryId.

A MAPI store provider assigns a unique ID string when an item is created in its store. Therefore, the EntryID property is not set for an Outlook item until it is saved or sent. The Entry ID changes when an item is moved into another store, for example, from your Inbox to a Microsoft Exchange Server public folder, or from one Personal Folders (.pst) file to another .pst file. Solutions should not depend on the EntryID property to be unique unless items will not be moved. The EntryID property returns a MAPI long-term Entry ID. For more information about long- and short-term EntryIDs, search http://msdn.microsoft.com for PidTagEntryId.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ FlagRequest { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) that indicates the requested action for a mail item. Read/write.

remarks.para: By default, a mail item is not marked with any flag and the default value for this property is the empty string. You can set the value of FlagRequest either through the user interface or programmatically. When you mark a mail item with a flag through the user interface, the default value of FlagRequest is "Follow up".

Docs.returns: A MailItem object that represents the new mail item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook.Conversation GetConversation() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Obtains a object that represents the conversation to which this item belongs.
Docs.returns: Returns a Conversation object that represents the conversation to which this item belongs.

remarks.para: GetConversation returns Nothing (a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) in C#) if no conversation exists for the item. No conversation exists for an item in the following scenarios:

item.para: The item has not been saved. An item can be saved programmatically, by user action, or by auto-save.
For an item that can be sent (for example, a mail item, appointment item, or contact item), the item has not been sent.
Conversations have been disabled through the Windows registry.

The store does not support the conversation view (for example, Outlook is running in classic online mode against a version of Microsoft Exchange earlier than Microsoft Exchange Server 2010). Use the property of the object to determine whether the store supports the conversation view.

public: property bool IsConflict { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean (bool in C#) that determines if the item is in conflict. Read-only.

remarks.para: Whether or not an item is in conflict is determined by the state of the application. For example, when a user is offline and tries to access an online folder the action will fail. In this scenario, the IsConflict property will return True.
If True, the specified item is in conflict.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ MessageClass { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) representing the message class for the Outlook item. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagMessageClass. The MessageClass property links the item to the form on which it is based. When an item is selected, Outlook uses the message class to locate the form and expose its properties, such as Reply commands.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) representing the mileage for an item. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool NoAging { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that is True to not age the Outlook item. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool OriginatorDeliveryReportRequested { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that determines whether the originator of the meeting item or mail message will receive a delivery report. Read/write.

remarks.para: Each transport provider that handles your message sends you a single delivery notification containing the names and addresses of each recipient to whom it was delivered. Delivery does not imply that the message has been read. True if the originator requested a delivery receipt on the message.
The OriginatorDeliveryReportRequested property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagOriginatorDeliveryReportRequested.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the parent Object of the specified object. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlPermission Permission { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlPermission get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlPermission value); };

Docs.summary: Sets or returns an constant that determines the permissions the recipients will have on the e-mail item. Read/write.

remarks.para: The Permission property should be synchronized with the property to accurately reflect the permission status of the SharingItem. Setting the PermissionTemplateGuid property to a valid GUID should also incur setting the Permission property to .

When no Information Rights Management (IRM) has been set up (in which case the Permission property is ), or the restriction is not to forward the SharingItem (in which case the Permission property is ), the value of the PermissionTemplateGuid property should be an empty string.

Although you can view content that is protected by IRM on any computer running the 2007 Microsoft Office system or a later version, you must have Microsoft Office Professional Edition 2003, Microsoft Office Outlook 2007, or a later version of Outlook to create or send an e-mail that is protected by IRM.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlPermissionService PermissionService { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlPermissionService get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlPermissionService value); };

Docs.summary: Sets or returns an constant that determines the permission service that will be used when sending a message protected by Information Rights Management (IRM). Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is useful only if you have more than one permission identity for a particular SMTP address.

While you can view content that is protected by IRM on any computer running the 2007 Microsoft Office system or a later version, you must have Microsoft Office Professional Edition 2003, Microsoft Office Outlook 2007, or a later version of Outlook to create or send an e-mail that is protected by IRM.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ PermissionTemplateGuid { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) value that represents the GUID of the template file to apply to the in order to specify Information Rights Management (IRM) permissions. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property complements the IRM properties on a MailItem object; that is, the property and the properties.

In particular, the PermissionTemplateGuid property should be synchronized with the Permission property to accurately reflect the permission status of the MailItem. Setting the PermissionTemplateGuid property to a valid GUID should also incur setting the Permission property to .

An empty string value for the PermissionTemplateGuid property means that there is no permission template file specified for the MailItem. For example, if no IRM has been set up (in which case the Permission property is ), or the restriction is not to forward the MailItem (in which case the Permission property is ).
If you attempt to set the PermissionTemplateGuid property for a received message (that is, the property of the MailItem is True), Microsoft Outlook returns an error.

Docs.summary: Prints the Outlook item using all default settings. The PrintOut method is the only Outlook method that can be used for printing.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RetentionExpirationDate As DateTime
public: property DateTime RetentionExpirationDate { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a value that specifies the date when the object expires, after which the Messaging Records Management (MRM) Assistant will delete the item. Read-only.

remarks.para: A retention policy is enabled and disabled by an administrator for a Microsoft Exchange Server on a mailbox level. This feature is available only on an Exchange Server 2010 mailbox with MRM 2.0 enabled.

Microsoft Outlook calculates the value of this property based on the item retention start date and the retention period, if Outlook is in cache or offline mode. The Exchange Server specifies the value if Outlook is in online mode.
In general, the retention start date for the item is determined as follows:

item.para: Received or sent items: the retention start date is the received date.
Nonrecurring calendar items: the retention start date is the appointment end date.
Recurring calendar items: the retention start date is the end date of last recurrence. If there is no end date, the item never expires.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RetentionPolicyName As String
public: property System::String ^ RetentionPolicyName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) that specifies the name of the retention policy. Read-only.

remarks.para: Retention is enabled and disabled by an administrator for a Microsoft Exchange Server on a mailbox level. The feature is available only on an Exchange Server 2010 mailbox with Messaging Records Management (MRM) 2.0 enabled. An example of a retention policy name is "Define time interval for expiration Quick Searches".

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ RTFBody { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a byte array that represents the body of the Microsoft Outlook item in Rich Text Format. Read/write.

remarks.para: You can use the System.Text.Encoding.AsciiEncoding.GetString() method in C# or Visual Basic to convert an array of bytes to a string.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Save() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Saves the Outlook item to the current folder or, if this is a new item, to the Outlook default folder for the item type.

remarks.para: If a mail item is an inline reply, calling Save on that mail item may fail and result in unexpected behavior.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SaveAs (string Path, object Type);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SaveAs([in]string Path, [in]object Type) runtime managed
Public Sub SaveAs (Path As String, Optional Type As Object)

Docs.param: The path in which to save the item.
The file type to save. Can be one of the constants in the enumeration.
Docs.summary: Saves the Microsoft Outlook item to the specified path and in the format of the specified file type. If the file type is not specified, the MSG format (.msg) is used.

remarks.para: Also note that even though olDoc is a valid OlSaveAsType constant, messages in HTML format cannot be saved in Document format, and the olDoc constant works only if Microsoft Word is set up as the default email editor.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Saved As Boolean
public: property bool Saved { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean (bool in C#) value that is True if the Outlook item has not been modified since the last save. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::MAPIFolder ^ SaveSentMessageFolder { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::MAPIFolder ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::MAPIFolder ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a object that represents the folder in which a copy of the e-mail message will be saved after being sent. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Send() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Sends the e-mail message.

remarks.para: The Send method sends an item using the default account specified for the session. In a session where multiple Microsoft Exchange accounts are defined in the profile, the first Exchange account added to the profile is the primary Exchange account, and is also the default account for the session. To specify a different account to send an item, set the property to the desired object and then call the Send method.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::AddressEntry ^ Sender { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::AddressEntry ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::AddressEntry ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an object that corresponds to the user of the account from which the is sent. Read/write.

remarks.para: In a session where multiple accounts are defined in the profile, you can set this property to specify the account from which to send a mail item. Set this property to the AddressEntry object of the user that is represented by the property of a specific account.
If you set the Sender property to an AddressEntry that does not have permissions to send messages on that account, Outlook will raise an error.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SenderEmailAddress As String
public: property System::String ^ SenderEmailAddress { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) that represents the e-mail address of the sender of the Outlook item. Read-only.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagSenderEmailAddress.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SenderEmailType As String
public: property System::String ^ SenderEmailType { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) that represents the type of entry for the e-mail address of the sender of the Outlook item, such as 'SMTP' for Internet address, 'EX' for a Microsoft Exchange server address, etc. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SenderName As String
public: property System::String ^ SenderName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) indicating the display name of the sender for the Outlook item. Read-only.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagSenderName.
If you wish to retrieve the fully qualified e-mail address of the sender, use the property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::Account ^ SendUsingAccount { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::Account ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::Account ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an object that represents the account under which the is to be sent. Read/write.

remarks.para: The SendUsingAccount property can be used to specify the account that should be used to send the MailItem when the method is called. This property returns Nothing (a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) in C#) if the account specified for the MailItem no longer exists.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlSensitivity Sensitivity { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlSensitivity get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Outlook::OlSensitivity value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a constant in the enumeration indicating the sensitivity for the Outlook item. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagSensitivity.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Sent As Boolean
public: property bool Sent { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean (bool in C#) value that indicates if a message has been sent. Read-only.

remarks.para: In general, there are three different kinds of messages: sent, posted, and saved. Sent messages are items sent to a recipient or public folder. Posted messages are created in a public folder. Saved messages are created and saved without either sending or posting.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SentOn As DateTime
public: property DateTime SentOn { DateTime get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a DateTime indicating the date and time on which the Outlook item was sent. Read-only.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagClientSubmitTime. When you send an item using the object's method, the transport provider sets the and SentOn properties for you.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SentOnBehalfOfName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a String (string in C#) indicating the display name for the intended sender of the mail message. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagSentRepresentingName.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Session As NameSpace

Docs.summary: Returns the object for the current session. Read-only.

remarks.para: The Session property and the method can be used interchangeably to obtain the NameSpace object for the current session. Both members serve the same purpose. For example, the following pairs of statements perform the same function:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ShowCategoriesDialog() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Displays the Show Categories dialog box, which allows you to select categories that correspond to the subject of the item.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Size As Integer
public: property int Size { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an Integer (int in C#) value indicating the size (in bytes) of the Outlook item. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Subject { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) indicating the subject for the Outlook item. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagSubject. The Subject property is the default property for Outlook items.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Submitted As Boolean
public: property bool Submitted { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean (bool in C#) value that is True if the item has been submitted. Read-only.

remarks.para: A message is always created and submitted in a folder, usually the Outbox.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime TaskCompletedDate { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime value that represents the completion date of the task for this . Read/write.

remarks.para: This property returns Nothing (a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) in C#) if the property is set to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime TaskDueDate { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime value that represents the due date of the task for this . Read/write.

remarks.para: This property returns Nothing (a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) in C#) if the property is set to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime TaskStartDate { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime value that represents the start date of the task for this object. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property returns Nothing (a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) in C#) if the property is set to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ TaskSubject { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) value that represents the subject of the task for the object. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property returns the value of the property if the property is set to False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ To { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a semicolon-delimited String (string in C#) list of display names for the To recipients for the Outlook item. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property contains the display names only. The To property corresponds to the MAPI property PidTagDisplayTo. The collection should be used to modify this property.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime ToDoTaskOrdinal { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a DateTime value that represents the ordinal value of the task for the . Read/write.

remarks.para: This property returns Nothing (a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) in C#) if the property is set to False.

This property is used to indicate how the task should be ordered within the parent groups, such as the Today group or the Tomorrow group, of the To-Do Bar. The value used in this property does not have any relation to the values of the , , or properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UnRead { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) value that is True if the Outlook item has not been opened (read). Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UserProperties As UserProperties

Docs.summary: Returns the collection that represents all the user properties for the Outlook item. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ VotingOptions { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) specifying a delimited string containing the voting options for the mail message. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property uses the character specified in the value name, sList, under HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\International in the Windows registry, as the delimiter for multiple voting options.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ VotingResponse { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a String (string in C#) specifying the voting response for the mail message. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property is usually set to one of the delimited values returned by the property on a reply to the original message.
